intro: Sasaella yessaensis, commonly known as the Yessa sasa, is a rare evergreen shrub native to the mountainous regions of northern Japan. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and narrow, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or brownish in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Sasaella yessaensis is considered a vulnerable species.
